system.description:
A character who cannot see his opponent due to an invisibility spell suffers a -6 penalty to all attack rolls made against his invisible foe; he has to guess where his target is by hearing. He suffers no penalty to his AC when attacked by an invisible character. Remember, someone who attacks loses the bonuses of invisibility!

When a creature becomes invisible, all items it carries and wears also become invisible. Any invisible item becomes visible again when it leaves the creature's possession (dropped, set down, etc.). A light source (such as a torch) may be made invisible, but the light given off will remain visible.
